channel.title: What does this golang code do?
channel.description: HI~，I am learning to use Metasploit to make malware and I have some problems. ![image|690x463](upload://jts0yxKZfbcelNDxMH4FUiAR9X3.jpeg) He asked me to convert the code into the following format. How do I convert it? ![image|690x402](upload://zMsTbSZeSK4UHQguv78b7Pz50UO.png) Also, what does this code do? Can you recommend a golang tutorial on this? ![image|669x255](upload://sR3UoWBiERc2Is8eISCfmcMpVU1.png)

item.title: What does this golang code do?
item.dc:creator: Cherry_CEN
item.description:
In this scene you are using the msfvenom to generate a meterpreter payload for windows x64 and the output is in C format. And you may want to replace the payload in you code, before doing it you need to convert the C format payload to the Golang format then replace it. You can doing it using your text editor or I recommand noninteractive editor. BTW are you school student ?

Read full topic

item.title: What does this golang code do?
item.dc:creator: zhihuiyuze
item.description:
I want to ask a question
shellcode_buf = []byte{
0xfc, 0x48, ----shellcode----, 0xd5,
}
What type does this code convert to shellcode? What code or language is the shellcore generated by msf?
I don’t know about this

Read full topic
